answers.text:
Hi Charles,
I agree. Programs for the community usually keep kids out of trouble. Here are a couple of resources from the Knowledge Network:
This is an overview of what programs ICMA has helped develop and implement for various local governments. http://icma.org/en/international/services/expertise/crime_prevention_security
This document is a few years old but still has some great ideas that could be useful. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5208/Community_Programs_that_Support_Children_and_Youth
I hope I was able to help!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: Charles Ball
text: Back in the early 1990s, many cities began incorporating night basketball into their community policing programs.  I always thought it was a wonderful way for Police Department to become more engaged with their communities while also reducing youth-related crimes.  First, are there still many programs in use?  And are there any studies on their effectiveness versus other crime prevention program?  Thank you
title: Police-sponsored Night Basketball Programs
